intro: Aciphylla takahea, commonly known as the Takahean spinifex, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in heads, a feature common to many members of its family. It is adapted to grow in coastal and inland sandy soils, often found in areas with low rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
